article.headline: Samford 70, Georgia St. 61
article.story: ATLANTA -- Kaylin Johnson scored 20 points and Samford controlled overtime for a 70-61 victory over Georgia State on Saturday night. The Bulldogs (4-3) scored the first seven points of overtime and took a 68-58 lead on Johnson's two free throws with 48 seconds left. The Panthers shot 8.3 percent from the field (1 for 12) in OT. Johnson was 6 for 8 from the field, including three 3-pointers, and 5 of 7 from the free throw line. Georgia State led 52-45 with 1:10 to play, but Samford's Andy King hit a game-tying 3-pointer with 9 seconds left and the Panthers (2-2) had a game-tying basket waved off with 3 seconds left because of a foul. Gregg Wooten scored 13 points and Josh Bedwell added 12 points for Samford. The Bulldogs were 23 of 30 from the foul line (76.7 percent) and Georgia State was 9 of 17 (52.9 percent). Javonte Maynor led Georgia State with 12 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
